com.arjuna.common.internal.util

Class ClassloadingUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arjuna.common.internal.util.ClassloadingUtility

  • public class ClassloadingUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility functions, used mainly by the EnvironmentBeans, for managing dynamic classloading.
    Author:
    Jonathan Halliday (jonathan.halliday@redhat.com) 2010-04

    • Method Detail

      • loadClass

        public static java.lang.Class loadClass(java.lang.String className)
        Load a class. No instantiation. In the event of error (ClassNotFound etc) this method will log the error and return null.
        Parameters:
        className - the name of the class to load and instantiate.
        Returns:
        the specified Class, or null.

      • loadClass

        public static <T> java.lang.Class<? extends T> loadClass(java.lang.Class<T> iface,
                                                         java.lang.String className)
        Load and return the named class, which is expected to be an implementation of the specified interface. In the event of error (ClassNotFound, ClassCast, ...) this method will log the error and return null.
        Parameters:
        iface - the expected interface type.
        className - the name of the class to load and instantiate.
        Returns:
        the specified class, or null.

      • loadAndInstantiateClass

        public static <T> T loadAndInstantiateClass(java.lang.Class<T> iface,
                                            java.lang.String className,
                                            java.lang.String environmentBeanInstanceName)
        Load, instantiate and return an instance of the named class, which is expected to be an implementation of the specified interface. In the event of error (ClassNotFound, ClassCast, can't instantiate, ...) this method will log the error and return null.
        Parameters:
        iface - the expected interface type.
        className - the name of the class to load and instantiate.
        environmentBeanInstanceName - When the class ctor requires a *EnvironmentBean instance, the name of the bean. null for default ctor or default bean instance..
        Returns:
        an instance of the specified class, or null.

      • loadAndInstantiateClasses

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> loadAndInstantiateClasses(java.lang.Class<T> iface,
                                                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> classNames)

      • loadAndInstantiateClassesWithInit

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> loadAndInstantiateClassesWithInit(java.lang.Class<T> iface,
                                                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> classNamesWithOptionalInitParams)

      • getNameForClass

        public static java.lang.String getNameForClass(java.lang.Object instance)
        Reverse mapping - obtain the class name for a given Object.
        Parameters:
        instance - the Object of interest
        Returns:
        the class name of the Object, or null.

      • getNamesForClasses

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getNamesForClasses(java.util.List<? extends java.lang.Object> instances)
        Reverse mapping - obtain the class names from a given set of Objects. If the input list is null a zero length list is returned. If the input list contains nulls, these will not be present in the returned list.
        Parameters:
        instances - a list of Objects of interest.
        Returns:
        a non-null list of zero or more elements, being class names of the Objects.
